function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Fear of infection leading to reduced visits to green spaces.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of free time as a reason for reduced visits to green spaces.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low ratio of urban green space per capita","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in visitors to green spaces during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Governmental regulation banning the use of green spaces during the pandemic","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial analyses based solely on vector data models may limit the understanding of contagious disease spread through other data types such as raster models or network data.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conducting an online survey may lead to a biased sample composition, potentially skewing the data analysis and conclusions.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Preference for online questionnaires among younger respondents may result in overrepresentation of this age group in the survey data, leading to age bias in the analysis and conclusions.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of questionnaire for data collection during a pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial analysis and gis methods for studying green spaces during a pandemic","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on gis and big data technologies for covid-19 response","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survey data collection lacking identifying information","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Broad promotion of the survey","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encouraging the use of private channels for survey participation","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conducting an online survey due to the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density in the city of krakow","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of a large student population","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited green spaces in the urban environment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to urban green spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate planning of residential areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in proportion of public green spaces in urban areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lifestyle changes due to the pandemic leading to longer socio-psychological and behavioral implications","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequalities in access to green spaces and their impact on health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unprecedented lockdown and mobility restrictions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compulsory mouth and nose covering","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Phases of pandemic and government actions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shut down of public spaces","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enforcement of specific restrictions and regulations","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public behavioral responses to covid-19 and previous outbreaks of infectious diseases","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of attention to official governmental media","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gender and age differences in embracing protective behaviors","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-representative online survey sample","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on official governmental media as the primary source of information","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trust in the source of information as a predictor of protective behaviors","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dissemination of outdated or wrong health information through social media","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low level of perceived susceptibility to covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative emotion as a predictor of protective behaviors","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low level of concern about potential infection transmitted by asymptomatic carriers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in maintaining physical distance in densely-populated cities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited explanation of the level of protective behaviors by knowledge alone","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High adoption level of protective behaviors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential response bias in study participants","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gender and age disparities in adopting protective behaviors","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of official advice on protective behaviors","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low covid-19 knowledge among respondents","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High risk perception of severity of covid-19 outbreak","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low perception of susceptibility to covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Comparison of respondents from high-risk areas with
